abstract.p: Letter from Walt Gardner, who taught for 28 years in Los Angeles Unified School District, holds the only possible reason for choosing teaching as career is the inner satisfaction that comes from perhaps making a difference in a young person's life (Gail Collins's May 9 column)

block.p: Re ''Waving the Standard,'' by Gail Collins (column, May 9): The only possible reason for choosing teaching as a career is the inner satisfaction that comes from perhaps making a difference one way or another in a young person's life. Money, power and fame certainly don't enter into the decision. They never have and they never will.

Re ''Waving the Standard,'' by Gail Collins (column, May 9): The only possible reason for choosing teaching as a career is the inner satisfaction that comes from perhaps making a difference one way or another in a young person's life. Money, power and fame certainly don't enter into the decision. They never have and they never will.
Henry Adams said it best: ''A teacher affects eternity; he can never tell where his influence stops.''
The writer taught for 28 years in the Los Angeles Unified School District.
